intro: Gynochthodes kanalensis, commonly known as the Kanal's gynochthodes, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are usually oval or elliptical in shape. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and less-studied species.
